Subject: RE: New Available Office Space 10 Floor AL Jazira Tower. 
--------------------------------------------------
Hi Mohammed, Joe, 

 

Following review of the lease agreement for the new unit, please note that it’s based on the same template recently signed for the renewal of the existing unit. 

 

However, please see below comments on terms some of which require further internal review/confirmation. 

 

Tenancy Contract

*	Lease Particulars

	*	Payment Terms: to be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date, as per previous lease.
	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement shall be transferred to this new lease.
	*	Tenancy Period: the lease term is for 5 years and does not include a break option.

chunks.text:
*	Tenancy Period: the lease term is for 5 years and does not include a break option. The tenant will not be permitted to terminate the lease without the prior approval and agreement with the landlord ------- TBC by Allied.
	*	Grace Period: there is a rent-free fitout period of 120 days, starting 15 October 2024 to complete the fitout of the new offices ------- TBC by Allied. 
	*	Rent Commencement Date: the rent shall become payable starting 15 February 2025 ---- TBC by Allied. 

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date.
*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, it would be best to have this section reviewed by @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> . 
*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office Unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease. I recommend we sign a deed of surrender/termination closer to the move in date of the new unit to ensure there are no delays or changes. You will also need to ensure that any advance rent paid for this unit is credited toward the new lease agreement.  

 

All remaining terms (dates, amounts, location, area, etc.) are subject to final review and validation from a commercial perspective.

Subject: RE: New Available Office Space 10 Floor AL Jazira Tower. 

 

Hi Mohammed, Joe, 

 

Following review of the lease agreement for the new unit, please note that it’s based on the same template recently signed for the renewal of the existing unit. 

 

However, please see below comments on terms some of which require further internal review/confirmation. 

 

Tenancy Contract

*	Lease Particulars

	*	Payment Terms: to be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date, as per previous lease.
	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement shall be transferred to this new lease.
	*	Tenancy Period: the lease term is for 5 years and does not include a break option. The tenant will not be permitted to terminate the lease without the prior approval and agreement with the landlord ------- TBC by Allied.
	*	Grace Period: there is a rent-free fitout period of 120 days, starting 15 October 2024 to complete the fitout of the new offices ------- TBC by Allied.

chunks.text:
*	Grace Period: there is a rent-free fitout period of 120 days, starting 15 October 2024 to complete the fitout of the new offices ------- TBC by Allied. 
	*	Rent Commencement Date: the rent shall become payable starting 15 February 2025 ---- TBC by Allied. 

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date.
*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, it would be best to have this section reviewed by @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> . 
*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office Unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease. I recommend we sign a deed of surrender/termination closer to the move in date of the new unit to ensure there are no delays or changes. You will also need to ensure that any advance rent paid for this unit is credited toward the new lease agreement.  

 

All remaining terms (dates, amounts, location, area, etc.) are subject to final review and validation from a commercial perspective. Let me know if there are any special conditions agreed with the landlord that should be reflected in the lease agreement. 

 

I look forward to your feedback.

Subject: RE: New Available Office Space 10 Floor AL Jazira Tower. 

 

Hi Mohammed, Joe, 

 

Following review of the lease agreement for the new unit, please note that it’s based on the same template recently signed for the renewal of the existing unit. 

 

However, please see below comments on terms some of which require further internal review/confirmation. 

 

Tenancy Contract

*	Lease Particulars

	*	Payment Terms: to be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date, as per previous lease. (The landlord requested for two payments yearly) 
	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement shall be transferred to this new lease. 
	*	Tenancy Period: the lease term is for 5 years and does not include a break option. The tenant will not be permitted to terminate the lease without the prior approval and agreement with the landlord ------- TBC by Allied.

chunks.text:
The tenant will not be permitted to terminate the lease without the prior approval and agreement with the landlord ------- TBC by Allied.
	*	Grace Period: there is a rent-free fitout period of 120 days, starting 15 October 2024 to complete the fitout of the new offices ------- TBC by Allied. 
	*	Rent Commencement Date: the rent shall become payable starting 15 February 2025 ---- TBC by Allied. (our first payment will be on 30/March/2025 as advised by @Joe Hobeika <mailto:Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com>  and the landlord are ok with that). 

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date.
*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, it would be best to have this section reviewed by @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> . 
*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office Unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease. I recommend we sign a deed of surrender/termination closer to the move in date of the new unit to ensure there are no delays or changes. You will also need to ensure that any advance rent paid for this unit is credited toward the new lease agreement.  

 

All remaining terms (dates, amounts, location, area, etc.) are subject to final review and validation from a commercial perspective.

halhoub.com <mailto:Grace.Milan@chalhoub.com> >; Celine Kibrit <Celine.Kibrit@chalhoub.com <mailto:Celine.Kibrit@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: RE: New Available Office Space 10 Floor AL Jazira Tower. 

 

Hi Mohammed, Joe, 

 

Following review of the lease agreement for the new unit, please note that it’s based on the same template recently signed for the renewal of the existing unit. 

 

However, please see below comments on terms some of which require further internal review/confirmation. 

 

Tenancy Contract

*	Lease Particulars

	*	Payment Terms: to be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date, as per previous lease. (The landlord requested for two payments yearly) 
	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement shall be transferred to this new lease. 
	*	Tenancy Period: the lease term is for 5 years and does not include a break option. The tenant will not be permitted to terminate the lease without the prior approval and agreement with the landlord ------- TBC by Allied.
	*	Grace Period: there is a rent-free fitout period of 120 days, starting 15 October 2024 to complete the fitout of the new offices ------- TBC by Allied. 
	*	Rent Commencement Date: the rent shall become payable starting 15 February 2025 ---- TBC by Allied. (our first payment will be on 30/March/2025 as advised by @Joe Hobeika <mailto:Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com>  and the landlord are ok with that). 

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date.

e 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date.
*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, it would be best to have this section reviewed by @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> . 
*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office Unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease. I recommend we sign a deed of surrender/termination closer to the move in date of the new unit to ensure there are no delays or changes. You will also need to ensure that any advance rent paid for this unit is credited toward the new lease agreement.  

 

All remaining terms (dates, amounts, location, area, etc.) are subject to final review and validation from a commercial perspective. Let me know if there are any special conditions agreed with the landlord that should be reflected in the lease agreement. 

 

I look forward to your feedback. 

 

Best regards

Suha 

 

SUHA ABILMONA​​​​

SENIOR MANAGER ‑ LEGAL

Following review of the lease agreement for the new unit, please note that it’s based on the same template recently signed for the renewal of the existing unit. 

 

However, please see below comments on terms some of which require further internal review/confirmation. 

 

Tenancy Contract

*	Lease Particulars

	*	Payment Terms: to be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date, as per previous lease. (The landlord requested for two payments yearly) 
	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement shall be transferred to this new lease. 
	*	Tenancy Period: the lease term is for 5 years and does not include a break option. The tenant will not be permitted to terminate the lease without the prior approval and agreement with the landlord ------- TBC by Allied.
	*	Grace Period: there is a rent-free fitout period of 120 days, starting 15 October 2024 to complete the fitout of the new offices ------- TBC by Allied. 
	*	Rent Commencement Date: the rent shall become payable starting 15 February 2025 ---- TBC by Allied. (our first payment will be on 30/March/2025 as advised by @Joe Hobeika <mailto:Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com>  and the landlord are ok with that). 

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date.
*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v.

*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, it would be best to have this section reviewed by @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> . 
*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office Unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease. I recommend we sign a deed of surrender/termination closer to the move in date of the new unit to ensure there are no delays or changes. You will also need to ensure that any advance rent paid for this unit is credited toward the new lease agreement.  

 

All remaining terms (dates, amounts, location, area, etc.) are subject to final review and validation from a commercial perspective. Let me know if there are any special conditions agreed with the landlord that should be reflected in the lease agreement. 

 

I look forward to your feedback. 

 

Best regards

Suha 

 

SUHA ABILMONA​​​​

SENIOR MANAGER ‑ LEGAL

REAL FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

+971 4 804 5000

Following review of the lease agreement for the new unit, please note that it’s based on the same template recently signed for the renewal of the existing unit. 

 

However, please see below comments on terms some of which require further internal review/confirmation. 

 

Tenancy Contract

*	Lease Particulars

	*	Payment Terms: to be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date, as per previous lease. (The landlord requested for two payments yearly) 
	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement shall be transferred to this new lease. 
	*	Tenancy Period: the lease term is for 5 years and does not include a break option. The tenant will not be permitted to terminate the lease without the prior approval and agreement with the landlord ------- TBC by Allied.
	*	Grace Period: there is a rent-free fitout period of 120 days, starting 15 October 2024 to complete the fitout of the new offices ------- TBC by Allied. 
	*	Rent Commencement Date: the rent shall become payable starting 15 February 2025 ---- TBC by Allied. (our first payment will be on 30/March/2025 as advised by @Joe Hobeika <mailto:Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com>  and the landlord are ok with that). 

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date.
*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v.

*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, it would be best to have this section reviewed by @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> . 
*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office Unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease. I recommend we sign a deed of surrender/termination closer to the move in date of the new unit to ensure there are no delays or changes. You will also need to ensure that any advance rent paid for this unit is credited toward the new lease agreement.  

 

All remaining terms (dates, amounts, location, area, etc.) are subject to final review and validation from a commercial perspective. Let me know if there are any special conditions agreed with the landlord that should be reflected in the lease agreement. 

 

I look forward to your feedback. 

 

Best regards

Suha

Following review of the lease agreement for the new unit, please note that it’s based on the same template recently signed for the renewal of the existing unit. 

 

However, please see below comments on terms some of which require further internal review/confirmation. 

 

Tenancy Contract

*	Lease Particulars

	*	Payment Terms: to be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date, as per previous lease. (The landlord requested for two payments yearly)  SAA: noted, if this is approved by management, it will need to be communicated to the accounts team to ensure they update their records and action the rent payments accordingly. 

 

	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement shall be transferred to this new lease. SAA: please advise. 

 

	*	Tenancy Period: the lease term is for 5 years and does not include a break option. The tenant will not be permitted to terminate the lease without the prior approval and agreement with the landlord ------- TBC by Allied. SAA: please confirm approval to proceed for 5 years without a break option.

 

	*	Grace Period: there is a rent-free fitout period of 120 days, starting 15 October 2024 to complete the fitout of the new offices ------- TBC by Allied. SAA: please advise.  

 

	*	Rent Commencement Date: the rent shall become payable starting 15 February 2025 ---- TBC by Allied. (our first payment will be on 30/March/2025 as advised by @Joe Hobeika <mailto:Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com>  and the landlord are ok with that).

(our first payment will be on 30/March/2025 as advised by @Joe Hobeika <mailto:Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com>  and the landlord are ok with that).  SAA: noted, and this should be reflected in the lease agreement. 

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date. SAA: to be revised to mention 2 annual installments. 

 

*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, it would be best to have this section reviewed by @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> . SAA: please advise.   

 

*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office Unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease. I recommend we sign a deed of surrender/termination closer to the move in date of the new unit to ensure there are no delays or changes. You will also need to ensure that any advance rent paid for this unit is credited toward the new lease agreement.  

 

All remaining terms (dates, amounts, location, area, etc.) are subject to final review and validation from a commercial perspective. Let me know if there are any special conditions agreed with the landlord that should be reflected in the lease agreement. 

 

I look forward to your feedback.

chunks.text:
Following review of the lease agreement for the new unit, please note that it’s based on the same template recently signed for the renewal of the existing unit. 

 

However, please see below comments on terms some of which require further internal review/confirmation. 

 

Tenancy Contract

*	Lease Particulars

	*	Payment Terms: to be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date, as per previous lease. (The landlord requested for two payments yearly)  SAA: noted, if this is approved by management, it will need to be communicated to the accounts team to ensure they update their records and action the rent payments accordingly. (Noted, believe @Gelynne Vargas <mailto:Gelynne.Vargas@chalhoub.com>  will take care of annual payments for the office). 

 

	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement shall be transferred to this new lease. SAA: please advise. (Noted, will inform the landlord). 

 

	*	Tenancy Period: the lease term is for 5 years and does not include a break option. The tenant will not be permitted to terminate the lease without the prior approval and agreement with the landlord ------- TBC by Allied. SAA: please confirm approval to proceed for 5 years without a break option. (Noted, will inform the landlord).

 

	*	Grace Period: there is a rent-free fitout period of 120 days, starting 15 October 2024 to complete the fitout of the new offices ------- TBC by Allied. SAA: please advise. (Noted, will inform the landlord).

chunks.text:
(Noted, will inform the landlord).

 

	*	Rent Commencement Date: the rent shall become payable starting 15 February 2025 ---- TBC by Allied. (our first payment will be on 30/March/2025 as advised by @Joe Hobeika <mailto:Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com>  and the landlord are ok with that).  SAA: noted, and this should be reflected in the lease agreement. (Noted, will inform the landlord).

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date. SAA: to be revised to mention 2 annual installments. 

 

*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, it would be best to have this section reviewed by @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> . SAA: please advise.   

 

*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office Unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease. I recommend we sign a deed of surrender/termination closer to the move in date of the new unit to ensure there are no delays or changes. You will also need to ensure that any advance rent paid for this unit is credited toward the new lease agreement.  

 

All remaining terms (dates, amounts, location, area, etc.) are subject to final review and validation from a commercial perspective.

*	Tenant Details: the lease agreement should be issued under Real Emirates LLC; attached is the trade license for reference. Please amend the lease agreement accordingly. 

 

	*	Payment Terms: we need to clarify that the rent will be paid in 2 annual installments by bank transfer.  

 

	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement under Allied Enterprises LLC shall be transferred to this new lease.

 

	*	Rent Commencement Date: as agreed by the parties, the 1st instalment is payable on 30 March 2025, and this should be reflected in the lease agreement. 

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to 2 annual installments payable by bank transfer.

 

*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, this is under final review by our insurance department. 

 

*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease (unit 1001). The landlord should provide a statement of account to ensure that any advance rent paid for this unit is credited toward the new lease agreement.  

 

Best regards

Suha

Subject: RE: New Available Office Space 10 Floor AL Jazira Tower. 

 

Hi Mohammed, Joe, 

 

Following review of the lease agreement for the new unit, please note that it’s based on the same template recently signed for the renewal of the existing unit. 

 

However, please see below comments on terms some of which require further internal review/confirmation. 

 

Tenancy Contract

*	Lease Particulars

	*	Payment Terms: to be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date, as per previous lease. (The landlord requested for two payments yearly)  SAA: noted, if this is approved by management, it will need to be communicated to the accounts team to ensure they update their records and action the rent payments accordingly. (Noted, believe @Gelynne Vargas <mailto:Gelynne.Vargas@chalhoub.com>  will take care of annual payments for the office). 

 

	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement shall be transferred to this new lease. SAA: please advise. (Noted, will inform the landlord). 

 

	*	Tenancy Period: the lease term is for 5 years and does not include a break option. The tenant will not be permitted to terminate the lease without the prior approval and agreement with the landlord ------- TBC by Allied. SAA: please confirm approval to proceed for 5 years without a break option. (Noted, will inform the landlord).

(Noted, will inform the landlord).

 

	*	Grace Period: there is a rent-free fitout period of 120 days, starting 15 October 2024 to complete the fitout of the new offices ------- TBC by Allied. SAA: please advise. (Noted, will inform the landlord).

 

	*	Rent Commencement Date: the rent shall become payable starting 15 February 2025 ---- TBC by Allied. (our first payment will be on 30/March/2025 as advised by @Joe Hobeika <mailto:Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com>  and the landlord are ok with that).  SAA: noted, and this should be reflected in the lease agreement. (Noted, will inform the landlord).

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date. SAA: to be revised to mention 2 annual installments. 

 

*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, it would be best to have this section reviewed by @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> . SAA: please advise.   

 

*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office Unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease. I recommend we sign a deed of surrender/termination closer to the move in date of the new unit to ensure there are no delays or changes.

Subject: RE: New Available Office Space 10 Floor AL Jazira Tower. 

 

Hi Mohammed, 

 

Unless there are any further comments, you can share the below with the landlord:

 

Tenancy Contract

*	Lease Particulars

	*	Tenant Details: the lease agreement should be issued under Real Emirates LLC; attached is the trade license for reference. Please amend the lease agreement accordingly. 

 

	*	Payment Terms: we need to clarify that the rent will be paid in 2 annual installments by bank transfer.  

 

	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement under Allied Enterprises LLC shall be transferred to this new lease.

 

	*	Rent Commencement Date: as agreed by the parties, the 1st instalment is payable on 30 March 2025, and this should be reflected in the lease agreement. 

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to 2 annual installments payable by bank transfer.

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to 2 annual installments payable by bank transfer.

 

*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, this is under final review by our insurance department. 

 

*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease (unit 1001). The landlord should provide a statement of account to ensure that any advance rent paid for this unit is credited toward the new lease agreement.  

 

Best regards

Suha

halhoub.com <mailto:Grace.Milan@chalhoub.com> >; Celine Kibrit <Celine.Kibrit@chalhoub.com <mailto:Celine.Kibrit@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: RE: New Available Office Space 10 Floor AL Jazira Tower. 

 

Hi Mohammed, Joe, 

 

Following review of the lease agreement for the new unit, please note that it’s based on the same template recently signed for the renewal of the existing unit. 

 

However, please see below comments on terms some of which require further internal review/confirmation. 

 

Tenancy Contract

*	Lease Particulars

	*	Payment Terms: to be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date, as per previous lease. (The landlord requested for two payments yearly)  SAA: noted, if this is approved by management, it will need to be communicated to the accounts team to ensure they update their records and action the rent payments accordingly. (Noted, believe @Gelynne Vargas <mailto:Gelynne.Vargas@chalhoub.com>  will take care of annual payments for the office). 

 

	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement shall be transferred to this new lease. SAA: please advise. (Noted, will inform the landlord). 

 

	*	Tenancy Period: the lease term is for 5 years and does not include a break option. The tenant will not be permitted to terminate the lease without the prior approval and agreement with the landlord ------- TBC by Allied. SAA: please confirm approval to proceed for 5 years without a break option. (Noted, will inform the landlord).

chunks.text:
(Noted, will inform the landlord).

 

	*	Grace Period: there is a rent-free fitout period of 120 days, starting 15 October 2024 to complete the fitout of the new offices ------- TBC by Allied. SAA: please advise. (Noted, will inform the landlord).

 

	*	Rent Commencement Date: the rent shall become payable starting 15 February 2025 ---- TBC by Allied. (our first payment will be on 30/March/2025 as advised by @Joe Hobeika <mailto:Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com>  and the landlord are ok with that).  SAA: noted, and this should be reflected in the lease agreement. (Noted, will inform the landlord).

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date. SAA: to be revised to mention 2 annual installments. 

 

*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, it would be best to have this section reviewed by @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> . SAA: please advise.   

 

*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office Unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease. I recommend we sign a deed of surrender/termination closer to the move in date of the new unit to ensure there are no delays or changes.

Subject: RE: New Available Office Space 10 Floor AL Jazira Tower. 

 

Hi Mohammed, 

 

Unless there are any further comments, you can share the below with the landlord:

 

Tenancy Contract

*	Lease Particulars

	*	Tenant Details: the lease agreement should be issued under Real Emirates LLC; attached is the trade license for reference. Please amend the lease agreement accordingly. 

 

	*	Payment Terms: we need to clarify that the rent will be paid in 2 annual installments by bank transfer.  

 

	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement under Allied Enterprises LLC shall be transferred to this new lease.

 

	*	Rent Commencement Date: as agreed by the parties, the 1st instalment is payable on 30 March 2025, and this should be reflected in the lease agreement. 

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to 2 annual installments payable by bank transfer.

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to 2 annual installments payable by bank transfer.

 

*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, this is under final review by our insurance department. 

 

*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease (unit 1001). The landlord should provide a statement of account to ensure that any advance rent paid for this unit is credited toward the new lease agreement.  

 

Best regards

Suha

Subject: RE: New Available Office Space 10 Floor AL Jazira Tower. 

 

Hi Mohammed, Joe, 

 

Following review of the lease agreement for the new unit, please note that it’s based on the same template recently signed for the renewal of the existing unit. 

 

However, please see below comments on terms some of which require further internal review/confirmation. 

 

Tenancy Contract

*	Lease Particulars

	*	Payment Terms: to be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date, as per previous lease. (The landlord requested for two payments yearly)  SAA: noted, if this is approved by management, it will need to be communicated to the accounts team to ensure they update their records and action the rent payments accordingly. (Noted, believe @Gelynne Vargas <mailto:Gelynne.Vargas@chalhoub.com>  will take care of annual payments for the office). 

 

	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement shall be transferred to this new lease. SAA: please advise. (Noted, will inform the landlord). 

 

	*	Tenancy Period: the lease term is for 5 years and does not include a break option. The tenant will not be permitted to terminate the lease without the prior approval and agreement with the landlord ------- TBC by Allied. SAA: please confirm approval to proceed for 5 years without a break option. (Noted, will inform the landlord).

chunks.text:
(Noted, will inform the landlord).

 

	*	Grace Period: there is a rent-free fitout period of 120 days, starting 15 October 2024 to complete the fitout of the new offices ------- TBC by Allied. SAA: please advise. (Noted, will inform the landlord).

 

	*	Rent Commencement Date: the rent shall become payable starting 15 February 2025 ---- TBC by Allied. (our first payment will be on 30/March/2025 as advised by @Joe Hobeika <mailto:Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com>  and the landlord are ok with that).  SAA: noted, and this should be reflected in the lease agreement. (Noted, will inform the landlord).

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date. SAA: to be revised to mention 2 annual installments. 

 

*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, it would be best to have this section reviewed by @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> . SAA: please advise.   

 

*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office Unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease. I recommend we sign a deed of surrender/termination closer to the move in date of the new unit to ensure there are no delays or changes.

to be sorted out internally - as you may recall, last year when renewing the existing lease there were internal discussions about the deposit currently held by the landlord from previous agreements. The accounts team need to confirm the amount to ensure that we receive the correct refund. Please make sure to liaise with them; accordingly, I’ve attached the last internal email discussion about this for your reference.

 

Tenancy Contract

*	Lease Particulars

	*	Tenant Details: the lease agreement should be issued under Real Emirates LLC; attached is the trade license for reference. Please amend the lease agreement accordingly. ok
	*	Payment Terms: we need to clarify that the rent will be paid in 2 annual instalments by bank transfer.  ok
	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement under Allied Enterprises LLC shall be transferred to this new lease. Ok however we might refund the current and you provide a new SD. 
	*	Rent Commencement Date: as agreed by the parties, the 1st instalment is payable on 30 March 2025, and this should be reflected in the lease agreement. ok

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to 2 annual installments payable by bank transfer. ok

 

*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, this is under final review by our insurance department. ok 

 

*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”.

.com <mailto:Grace.Milan@chalhoub.com> >; Mohammed El Neel <Mohammed.Elneel@chalhoub.com <mailto:Mohammed.Elneel@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: RE: New Available Office Space 10 Floor AL Jazira Tower. 

 

Hi Mohammed, 

 

Unless there are any further comments, you can share the below with the landlord:

 

Tenancy Contract

*	Lease Particulars

	*	Tenant Details: the lease agreement should be issued under Real Emirates LLC; attached is the trade license for reference. Please amend the lease agreement accordingly. 

 

	*	Payment Terms: we need to clarify that the rent will be paid in 2 annual installments by bank transfer.  

 

	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement under Allied Enterprises LLC shall be transferred to this new lease.

 

	*	Rent Commencement Date: as agreed by the parties, the 1st instalment is payable on 30 March 2025, and this should be reflected in the lease agreement. 

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to 2 annual installments payable by bank transfer.

 

*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, this is under final review by our insurance department. 

 

*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease (unit 1001).

Subject: RE: New Available Office Space 10 Floor AL Jazira Tower. 

 

Hi Mohammed, Joe, 

 

Following review of the lease agreement for the new unit, please note that it’s based on the same template recently signed for the renewal of the existing unit. 

 

However, please see below comments on terms some of which require further internal review/confirmation. 

 

Tenancy Contract

*	Lease Particulars

	*	Payment Terms: to be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date, as per previous lease. (The landlord requested for two payments yearly)  SAA: noted, if this is approved by management, it will need to be communicated to the accounts team to ensure they update their records and action the rent payments accordingly. (Noted, believe @Gelynne Vargas <mailto:Gelynne.Vargas@chalhoub.com>  will take care of annual payments for the office). 

 

	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement shall be transferred to this new lease. SAA: please advise. (Noted, will inform the landlord). 

 

	*	Tenancy Period: the lease term is for 5 years and does not include a break option. The tenant will not be permitted to terminate the lease without the prior approval and agreement with the landlord ------- TBC by Allied. SAA: please confirm approval to proceed for 5 years without a break option. (Noted, will inform the landlord).

chunks.text:
(Noted, will inform the landlord).

 

	*	Grace Period: there is a rent-free fitout period of 120 days, starting 15 October 2024 to complete the fitout of the new offices ------- TBC by Allied. SAA: please advise. (Noted, will inform the landlord).

 

	*	Rent Commencement Date: the rent shall become payable starting 15 February 2025 ---- TBC by Allied. (our first payment will be on 30/March/2025 as advised by @Joe Hobeika <mailto:Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com>  and the landlord are ok with that).  SAA: noted, and this should be reflected in the lease agreement. (Noted, will inform the landlord).

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date. SAA: to be revised to mention 2 annual installments. 

 

*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, it would be best to have this section reviewed by @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> . SAA: please advise.   

 

*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office Unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease. I recommend we sign a deed of surrender/termination closer to the move in date of the new unit to ensure there are no delays or changes.

Subject: RE: New Available Office Space 10 Floor AL Jazira Tower. 

 

Hi Mohammed, 

 

I’ve copied the landlord’s fedeback below (highlighted in yellow). 

Please refer to my feedback below in red. 

 

The point re- the security deposit needs to be sorted out internally - as you may recall, last year when renewing the existing lease there were internal discussions about the deposit currently held by the landlord from previous agreements. The accounts team need to confirm the amount to ensure that we receive the correct refund. Please make sure to liaise with them; accordingly, I’ve attached the last internal email discussion about this for your reference.

 

Tenancy Contract

*	Lease Particulars

	*	Tenant Details: the lease agreement should be issued under Real Emirates LLC; attached is the trade license for reference. Please amend the lease agreement accordingly. ok
	*	Payment Terms: we need to clarify that the rent will be paid in 2 annual instalments by bank transfer.

	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement under Allied Enterprises LLC shall be transferred to this new lease. Ok however we might refund the current and you provide a new SD. 
	*	Rent Commencement Date: as agreed by the parties, the 1st instalment is payable on 30 March 2025, and this should be reflected in the lease agreement. ok

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to 2 annual installments payable by bank transfer. ok

 

*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, this is under final review by our insurance department. ok 

 

*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. As per the business standard is 90 days SAA: ok, noted – 90 days is acceptable please amend accordingly. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease (unit 1001). The landlord should provide a statement of account to ensure that any advance rent paid for this unit is credited toward the new lease agreement.  ok

 

Best regards

Suha

Subject: RE: New Available Office Space 10 Floor AL Jazira Tower. 

 

Hi Mohammed, 

 

Unless there are any further comments, you can share the below with the landlord:

 

Tenancy Contract

*	Lease Particulars

	*	Tenant Details: the lease agreement should be issued under Real Emirates LLC; attached is the trade license for reference. Please amend the lease agreement accordingly. 

 

	*	Payment Terms: we need to clarify that the rent will be paid in 2 annual installments by bank transfer.  

 

	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement under Allied Enterprises LLC shall be transferred to this new lease.

 

	*	Rent Commencement Date: as agreed by the parties, the 1st instalment is payable on 30 March 2025, and this should be reflected in the lease agreement. 

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to 2 annual installments payable by bank transfer.

 

*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, this is under final review by our insurance department. 

 

*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease (unit 1001).

halhoub.com <mailto:Grace.Milan@chalhoub.com> >; Celine Kibrit <Celine.Kibrit@chalhoub.com <mailto:Celine.Kibrit@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: RE: New Available Office Space 10 Floor AL Jazira Tower. 

 

Hi Mohammed, Joe, 

 

Following review of the lease agreement for the new unit, please note that it’s based on the same template recently signed for the renewal of the existing unit. 

 

However, please see below comments on terms some of which require further internal review/confirmation. 

 

Tenancy Contract

*	Lease Particulars

	*	Payment Terms: to be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date, as per previous lease. (The landlord requested for two payments yearly)  SAA: noted, if this is approved by management, it will need to be communicated to the accounts team to ensure they update their records and action the rent payments accordingly. (Noted, believe @Gelynne Vargas <mailto:Gelynne.Vargas@chalhoub.com>  will take care of annual payments for the office). 

 

	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement shall be transferred to this new lease. SAA: please advise. (Noted, will inform the landlord). 

 

	*	Tenancy Period: the lease term is for 5 years and does not include a break option. The tenant will not be permitted to terminate the lease without the prior approval and agreement with the landlord ------- TBC by Allied. SAA: please confirm approval to proceed for 5 years without a break option. (Noted, will inform the landlord).

chunks.text:
(Noted, will inform the landlord).

 

	*	Grace Period: there is a rent-free fitout period of 120 days, starting 15 October 2024 to complete the fitout of the new offices ------- TBC by Allied. SAA: please advise. (Noted, will inform the landlord).

 

	*	Rent Commencement Date: the rent shall become payable starting 15 February 2025 ---- TBC by Allied. (our first payment will be on 30/March/2025 as advised by @Joe Hobeika <mailto:Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com>  and the landlord are ok with that).  SAA: noted, and this should be reflected in the lease agreement. (Noted, will inform the landlord).

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date. SAA: to be revised to mention 2 annual installments. 

 

*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, it would be best to have this section reviewed by @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> . SAA: please advise.   

 

*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office Unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease. I recommend we sign a deed of surrender/termination closer to the move in date of the new unit to ensure there are no delays or changes.

I recommend we sign a deed of surrender/termination closer to the move in date of the new unit to ensure there are no delays or changes. You will also need to ensure that any advance rent paid for this unit is credited toward the new lease agreement.  

 

All remaining terms (dates, amounts, location, area, etc.) are subject to final review and validation from a commercial perspective. Let me know if there are any special conditions agreed with the landlord that should be reflected in the lease agreement. 

 

I look forward to your feedback. 

 

Best regards

Suha 

 

SUHA ABILMONA​​​​

Subject: RE: New Available Office Space 10 Floor AL Jazira Tower. 

 

Hi Mohammed, 

 

I’ve copied the landlord’s fedeback below (highlighted in yellow). 

Please refer to my feedback below in red. 

 

The point re- the security deposit needs to be sorted out internally - as you may recall, last year when renewing the existing lease there were internal discussions about the deposit currently held by the landlord from previous agreements. The accounts team need to confirm the amount to ensure that we receive the correct refund. Please make sure to liaise with them; accordingly, I’ve attached the last internal email discussion about this for your reference.

 

Tenancy Contract

*	Lease Particulars

	*	Tenant Details: the lease agreement should be issued under Real Emirates LLC; attached is the trade license for reference. Please amend the lease agreement accordingly. ok
	*	Payment Terms: we need to clarify that the rent will be paid in 2 annual instalments by bank transfer.  ok
	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement under Allied Enterprises LLC shall be transferred to this new lease. Ok however we might refund the current and you provide a new SD. 
	*	Rent Commencement Date: as agreed by the parties, the 1st instalment is payable on 30 March 2025, and this should be reflected in the lease agreement. Ok       SAA (2.Oct.24): this has not been included in the attached lease agreement – please clarify.

Ok       SAA (2.Oct.24): this has not been included in the attached lease agreement – please clarify. 

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to 2 annual installments payable by bank transfer. ok

 

*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, this is under final review by our insurance department. ok 

 

*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. As per the business standard is 90 days SAA: ok, noted – 90 days is acceptable please amend accordingly. SAA (2.Oct.24): there is still a typo in the English and Arabic texts, it needs to read “ninety (90) days” as agreed – please update accordingly. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease (unit 1001). The landlord should provide a statement of account to ensure that any advance rent paid for this unit is credited toward the new lease agreement.  ok

 

Best regards

Suha

*	Tenant Details: the lease agreement should be issued under Real Emirates LLC; attached is the trade license for reference. Please amend the lease agreement accordingly. 

 

	*	Payment Terms: we need to clarify that the rent will be paid in 2 annual installments by bank transfer.  

 

	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement under Allied Enterprises LLC shall be transferred to this new lease.

 

	*	Rent Commencement Date: as agreed by the parties, the 1st instalment is payable on 30 March 2025, and this should be reflected in the lease agreement. 

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to 2 annual installments payable by bank transfer.

 

*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, this is under final review by our insurance department. 

 

*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease (unit 1001). The landlord should provide a statement of account to ensure that any advance rent paid for this unit is credited toward the new lease agreement.  

 

Best regards

Suha 

 

 

SUHA ABILMONA​​​​

SENIOR MANAGER ‑ LEGAL

REAL FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

+971 4 804 5000

halhoub.com <mailto:Grace.Milan@chalhoub.com> >; Celine Kibrit <Celine.Kibrit@chalhoub.com <mailto:Celine.Kibrit@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: RE: New Available Office Space 10 Floor AL Jazira Tower. 

 

Hi Mohammed, Joe, 

 

Following review of the lease agreement for the new unit, please note that it’s based on the same template recently signed for the renewal of the existing unit. 

 

However, please see below comments on terms some of which require further internal review/confirmation. 

 

Tenancy Contract

*	Lease Particulars

	*	Payment Terms: to be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date, as per previous lease. (The landlord requested for two payments yearly)  SAA: noted, if this is approved by management, it will need to be communicated to the accounts team to ensure they update their records and action the rent payments accordingly. (Noted, believe @Gelynne Vargas <mailto:Gelynne.Vargas@chalhoub.com>  will take care of annual payments for the office). 

 

	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement shall be transferred to this new lease. SAA: please advise. (Noted, will inform the landlord). 

 

	*	Tenancy Period: the lease term is for 5 years and does not include a break option. The tenant will not be permitted to terminate the lease without the prior approval and agreement with the landlord ------- TBC by Allied. SAA: please confirm approval to proceed for 5 years without a break option. (Noted, will inform the landlord).

chunks.text:
(Noted, will inform the landlord).

 

	*	Grace Period: there is a rent-free fitout period of 120 days, starting 15 October 2024 to complete the fitout of the new offices ------- TBC by Allied. SAA: please advise. (Noted, will inform the landlord).

 

	*	Rent Commencement Date: the rent shall become payable starting 15 February 2025 ---- TBC by Allied. (our first payment will be on 30/March/2025 as advised by @Joe Hobeika <mailto:Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com>  and the landlord are ok with that).  SAA: noted, and this should be reflected in the lease agreement. (Noted, will inform the landlord).

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date. SAA: to be revised to mention 2 annual installments. 

 

*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, it would be best to have this section reviewed by @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> . SAA: please advise.   

 

*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office Unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease. I recommend we sign a deed of surrender/termination closer to the move in date of the new unit to ensure there are no delays or changes.

I recommend we sign a deed of surrender/termination closer to the move in date of the new unit to ensure there are no delays or changes. You will also need to ensure that any advance rent paid for this unit is credited toward the new lease agreement.  

 

All remaining terms (dates, amounts, location, area, etc.) are subject to final review and validation from a commercial perspective. Let me know if there are any special conditions agreed with the landlord that should be reflected in the lease agreement. 

 

I look forward to your feedback. 

 

Best regards

Suha 

 

SUHA ABILMONA​​​​

SENIOR MANAGER ‑ LEGAL

REAL FZE

DUBAI

to be sorted out internally - as you may recall, last year when renewing the existing lease there were internal discussions about the deposit currently held by the landlord from previous agreements. The accounts team need to confirm the amount to ensure that we receive the correct refund. Please make sure to liaise with them; accordingly, I’ve attached the last internal email discussion about this for your reference.

 

Tenancy Contract

*	Lease Particulars

	*	Tenant Details: the lease agreement should be issued under Real Emirates LLC; attached is the trade license for reference. Please amend the lease agreement accordingly. ok
	*	Payment Terms: we need to clarify that the rent will be paid in 2 annual instalments by bank transfer.  ok
	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement under Allied Enterprises LLC shall be transferred to this new lease. Ok however we might refund the current and you provide a new SD. 
	*	Rent Commencement Date: as agreed by the parties, the 1st instalment is payable on 30 March 2025, and this should be reflected in the lease agreement. Ok       SAA (2.Oct.24): this has not been included in the attached lease agreement – please clarify. 

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to 2 annual installments payable by bank transfer. ok

 

*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, this is under final review by our insurance department. ok 

 

*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”.

*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. As per the business standard is 90 days SAA: ok, noted – 90 days is acceptable please amend accordingly. SAA (2.Oct.24): there is still a typo in the English and Arabic texts, it needs to read “ninety (90) days” as agreed – please update accordingly. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease (unit 1001). The landlord should provide a statement of account to ensure that any advance rent paid for this unit is credited toward the new lease agreement.  ok

 

Best regards

Suha

chunks.text:
*	Tenant Details: the lease agreement should be issued under Real Emirates LLC; attached is the trade license for reference. Please amend the lease agreement accordingly. 

 

	*	Payment Terms: we need to clarify that the rent will be paid in 2 annual installments by bank transfer.  

 

	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement under Allied Enterprises LLC shall be transferred to this new lease.

 

	*	Rent Commencement Date: as agreed by the parties, the 1st instalment is payable on 30 March 2025, and this should be reflected in the lease agreement. 

 

Tenancy Terms & Conditions

*	Clause 2.3, Rent Payment: as mentioned above, the payment terms should be revised to 2 annual installments payable by bank transfer.

 

*	Clause 4.2, Insurance: considering this is a new lease (v. renewal) and there will be fitout works, this is under final review by our insurance department. 

 

*	Clause 5.11, Termination: there is a slight typo to be corrected as follows “thirty sixty (60) days…”. 

 

On the other hand, please note that the lease agreement for the current office unit 702 is valid until 9 December 2025. We will need to terminate this agreement effective one day prior to the commencement date of the new lease (unit 1001). The landlord should provide a statement of account to ensure that any advance rent paid for this unit is credited toward the new lease agreement.  

 

Best regards

Suha 

 

 

SUHA ABILMONA​​​​

SENIOR MANAGER ‑ LEGAL

REAL FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

+971 4 804 5000

halhoub.com <mailto:Grace.Milan@chalhoub.com> >; Celine Kibrit <Celine.Kibrit@chalhoub.com <mailto:Celine.Kibrit@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: RE: New Available Office Space 10 Floor AL Jazira Tower. 

 

Hi Mohammed, Joe, 

 

Following review of the lease agreement for the new unit, please note that it’s based on the same template recently signed for the renewal of the existing unit. 

 

However, please see below comments on terms some of which require further internal review/confirmation. 

 

Tenancy Contract

*	Lease Particulars

	*	Payment Terms: to be revised to quarterly installments payable by bank transfer to be settled no later than the start of the relevant quarter due date, as per previous lease. (The landlord requested for two payments yearly)  SAA: noted, if this is approved by management, it will need to be communicated to the accounts team to ensure they update their records and action the rent payments accordingly. (Noted, believe @Gelynne Vargas <mailto:Gelynne.Vargas@chalhoub.com>  will take care of annual payments for the office). 

 

	*	Security Deposit: we need to mention that the amount currently held by the landlord under the existing agreement shall be transferred to this new lease. SAA: please advise. (Noted, will inform the landlord). 

 

	*	Tenancy Period: the lease term is for 5 years and does not include a break option.
